abstract: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation is not on board with Washington Mutual’s bankruptcy reorganization plan, including a massive tax refund to JPMorgan Chase, according to the company and a Wall Street Journal report.
snippet: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation is not on board with Washington Mutual’s bankruptcy reorganization plan, including a massive tax refund to JPMorgan Chase, according to the company and a Wall Street Journal report.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation is not on board with Washington Mutual‘s bankruptcy reorganization plan, including a massive tax refund to JPMorgan Chase, according to the company and a Wall Street Journal report.

headline.main: WaMu-JPMorgan Tax Break Said to Trip on F.D.I.C.

abstract: CKX, the owner of the “American Idol” and “So You Think You Can Dance” franchises, confirmed on Monday that it is holding talks to sell itself, after media reports said that the entertainment company was negotiating with its chief executive and One Equity Partners, a private equity firm owned by JPMorgan Chase.

lead_paragraph: CKX, the owner of the “American Idol” and “So You Think You Can Dance” franchises, confirmed on Monday that it is holding talks to sell itself, after media reports said that the entertainment company was negotiating with its chief executive and One Equity Partners, a private equity firm owned by JPMorgan Chase.
